47524378.extract:
Julia Driver is Professor of Philosophy at Washington University in St. Louis. She is the author of Uneasy Virtue, Consequentialism, and Ethics: The Fundamentals, as well as many articles in ethics and moral psychology. She is the leading proponent of a consequentialist approach to virtue theory. Before coming to Washington University, she taught at Dartmouth College and Brooklyn College CUNY. She received her PhD from Johns Hopkins University in 1990, and her BA from the University of Texas at Austin in 1983.
She has received a Laurance S. Rockefeller Fellowship from Princeton University, a Young Scholar's Award from Cornell University's Program on Ethics and Public Life, an NEH Fellowship, and an HLA Hart Fellowship at Oxford University. She chaired the American Philosophical Association's Committee on the Status and Future of the Profession from 2012-2015.
